refnamediv.refpurpose: Warp the spectral envelope of a PVS signal

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Warp the spectral envelope of a PVS signal by means of shifting and scaling.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: fsig pvswarp fsigin, kscal, kshift[, klowest, kmeth, kgain, kcoefs]

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kscal -- spectral envelope scaling ratio. Values > 1 stretch the envelope and < 1 compress it.
kshift -- spectral envelope shift, values > 0 shift the envelope linearly upwards and values < 0 shift it downwards.
klowest -- lowest frequency shifted (affects only kshift, defaults to 0).
kmethod -- spectral envelope extraction method 1: liftered cepstrum method; 2: true envelope method (defaults to 1).
kcoefs -- number of cepstrum coefs used in formant preservation (defaults to 80).

warning.para: It is unsafe to use the same f-variable for both input and output of pvs opcodes. Using the same one might lead to undefined behavior on some opcodes. Use a different one on the left and right sides of the opcode.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the pvswarp opcode. It uses the file pvswarp.csd.
Example of the pvswarp opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
Used with vocal sounds, it will shift the formants and result in a changed vowel timbre, similar to the effect of a singer inhaling helium (the 'donald duck' effect).
